# UIKey

**Class**

An object that provides information about the state of a keyboard key.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class UIKey
```

## Overview

[doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIKey] provides relevant information about the current state of a key on a keyboard as a user presses and releases the key. To learn more, see [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/handling-key-presses-made-on-a-physical-keyboard].

## Determining key type

- **keyCode**: The HID usage code of the key.
- **modifierFlags**: The modifier keys pressed and held while the user presses the key.

## Getting key characters

- **characters**: A string that represents the text value of the key combined with any active modifier keys.
- **charactersIgnoringModifiers**: A string that represents the text value of the key without modifier keys.

## Physical keyboards

- **Handling key presses made on a physical keyboard**: Detect when someone presses and releases keys on a physical keyboard.
- **Navigating an app’s user interface using a keyboard**: Navigate between user interface elements using a keyboard and focusable UI elements in iPad apps and apps built with Mac Catalyst.
- **Adding hardware keyboard support to your app**: Enhance interactions with your app by handling raw keyboard events, writing custom keyboard shortcuts, and working with gesture recognizers.
- **UIKeyboardHIDUsage**: A set of HID usage codes that identify the keys of a USB keyboard.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
- Sendable
